## Why Reverse Scoring?

Questionnaires often include **negatively worded items** to:

- Reduce response bias
- Check if participants are paying attention
- Balance the scale

**Example:**

- Positive: "I am the life of the party"
- Negative: "I don't like to draw attention to myself"

---

## The Problem

If someone scores **5** (strongly agree) on both:

- "I am outgoing" → High extraversion ✓
- "I prefer to be alone" → High extraversion? ✗

We need to **reverse** the negative item before summing!

---

## The Formula

For a **1-5 scale**:

$$\text{reversed} = 6 - \text{original}$$

| Original | Reversed |
|----------|----------|
| 1 | 5 |
| 2 | 4 |
| 3 | 3 |
| 4 | 2 |
| 5 | 1 |

---

## Why 6?

The formula is: `(max + min) - original`

For a 1-5 scale: `(5 + 1) - original = 6 - original`

For a 1-7 scale: `(7 + 1) - original = 8 - original`

---

## In Our Data

Items `p4` and `p5` are negatively worded.

```{webr-r}
library(readr)
data_url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/LittleMonkeyLab/datarepo/main/personality_lab.csv"
data <- read_csv(data_url, show_col_types = FALSE)

# Look at p4 values
head(data$p4)
```

---

## Creating Reversed Columns

```{webr-r}
library(readr)
data_url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/LittleMonkeyLab/datarepo/main/personality_lab.csv"
data <- read_csv(data_url, show_col_types = FALSE)

# Reverse score p4 and p5
data$rev_p4 <- 6 - data$p4
data$rev_p5 <- 6 - data$p5

# Check it worked
head(data[, c("p4", "rev_p4")])
```

---

## Verifying the Reversal

The original and reversed should sum to 6:

```{webr-r}
library(readr)
data_url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/LittleMonkeyLab/datarepo/main/personality_lab.csv"
data <- read_csv(data_url, show_col_types = FALSE)

data$rev_p4 <- 6 - data$p4

# Check: do they sum to 6?
head(data$p4 + data$rev_p4)
```

---

## Creating a Total Score

Sum **all items**, using the **reversed** versions:

```{webr-r}
library(readr)
data_url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/LittleMonkeyLab/datarepo/main/personality_lab.csv"
data <- read_csv(data_url, show_col_types = FALSE)

data$rev_p4 <- 6 - data$p4
data$rev_p5 <- 6 - data$p5

# Create total score
data$pers_score <- data$p1 + data$p2 + data$p3 +
                   data$rev_p4 + data$rev_p5

head(data$pers_score)
```

---

## Common Mistake!

Using the **original** items instead of **reversed**:

```r
# WRONG! Using p4 instead of rev_p4
data$wrong_score <- data$p1 + data$p2 + data$p3 +
                    data$p4 + data$p5
```

Always double-check you're using `rev_` versions!
